content:
Hey @T-lang --

I updated https://lang-team.rust-lang.org/initiatives.html with the list of active initiatives and their liaisons.
It seems clear that I ... am liasing a lot of things :)
• Are there missing items on the list? e.g., are you pursuing something (stabilizing a tracking issue, etc) that is not on the list, perhaps working with someone on lang team? speak up!
• Per the new process, the liaisons are responsible for preparing updates for the upcoming planning meeting

The other question is:

  • who will be liaison for @scottmcm on the Try trait and so forth =)
• does anyone want to take on the liaison role for any of the places where my name appears :)

nikomatsakis said:

  • Are there missing items on the list? e.g., are you pursuing something (stabilizing a tracking issue, etc) that is not on the list, perhaps working with someone on lang team? speak up!

Was just thinking of how unsafe code guidelines fits into this in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88375, and realized it's not on the list
That might be representative of reality right now "not an active initiative", but it seems like (a) we might want to fix that and (b) if so, we probably shouldn't be expecting results from it :)
I think that it is not active at this time, but I am interested in seeing it become more active
